alert.note: Alert for San Joaquin (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 17 at 8:58AM PDT until further notice by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Sacramento CA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in California... San Joaquin River Near Vernalis affecting San Joaquin County. .The San Joaquin River at Vernalis has reached flood stage and is expected to rise above 29.5 feet early Sunday morning. This is a result of latest storm`s runoff and reservoir operators maintaining elevated releases due to large snowpack. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...San Joaquin River near Vernalis. * WHEN...From this morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 21.0 feet, Seepage begins into crop area outside of levees. At 26.0 feet, Severe seepage occurs outside the levees. The area covered by seepage will increase as the river stage rises. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 AM PDT Friday the stage was 29.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to 29.6 feet early Sunday morning. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 29.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 29.8 feet on 03/18/1986. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. For more hydrologic information and stage definitions refer to the following web site: wrh.noaa.gov/sto/hydro_data.php The next statement will be issued Saturday morning at 900 AM PDT.
